alert.note: Alert for Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 4:18PM MDT until June 06 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN SWEET GRASS COUNTY... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar previously indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain on the eastern slopes of the Crazy Mountains, mainly around Big Timber Creek. Radar estimates of between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell from these storms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Rural roads may become impassable. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Sweet Grass County The heavy rainfall has ended, but flood waters will continue to run high in the warned area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
